intro: Parabarium langbiani, commonly known as the Langbian parabarium, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Langbian Plateau in southern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic compounds. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with finely divided leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the cool climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
